dialogues.text: I did. You know: they say cinnamon is wonderful for your pores. Read that on the internet. And that ideally you should be wearing gloves to bed, but I find that would interfere with my social agenda. Problem is: I get a reaction to camphor so I can't use traditional remedies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could pay cash, I could probably drop the price a little. To, say, seventeen... (as Frank squeezes a little) ... sixteen each.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) That would be lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: overseeing the construction, reviewing his list of tasks on his fingers, suspecting he's missed one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Power, surveillance, transport...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything I can do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny's eyes flash from Tishkoff to Saul, behind him, dressed in his usual frumpy attire: that's what he missed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tailor fits Saul for the finest suits Tishkoff's money can buy. As Saul smoothes out a coat sleeve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nice material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Armani, Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul's not fooling anyone: he's scared, right down to his Florsheims. Danny nods to the tailor: "Give us a moment."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul, you sure you're ready to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul turns away, and when he faces Danny again, his entire aspect has changed: His features stone, his eyes icicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever question me again, Daniel, you won't wake up the following morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange a long, fierce glance; Saul's eyes never waver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny signals Tishkoff: let's pay, and Saul immediately slumps into his old self. To a mirror, he practices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  My name is Lyman Zerga... (this time a little deeper) My name is Lyman Zerga...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul's dressed completely (and immaculately) now in Armani, with his hair slicked back, a brief moustache on his lip, and impenetrably dark glasses riding the bridge of his nose. He continues to practice, his accent even deeper now and specifying no geographic origin -- could be Scottish, could be Israeli...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Lyman Zerga... My name is Lyman Zerga... Danny passes him an envelope full of $100 bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a little over twenty grand there, Saul. Try to make it last. Saul pats down his pockets for something he can't find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him Rolaids)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bought you a fresh roll. The limo pulls to a stop, and outside there is a flurry of FOOTSTEPS before Saul's door swings open, and Turk and Virgil (both costumed as bodyguards) stand waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zerga, we're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, Lyman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates, then gets out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck is for losers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul, as Lyman Zerga, makes as low-profile an entrance into the Bellagio as he can with bodyguards preceding and trailing him. He approaches a V.I.P CONCIERGE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, sir. How can I be of service?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Lyman Zerga.   I'd like a suite, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a reservation with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long glare at him) I don't make reservations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A longer glance at Lyman's bodyguards tells the Concierge this is not a man to be denied. As he jumps to it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside a restaurant's entrance, Rusty and Linus sit before two slot machines, idly dropping in quarters as they watch Saul receive the royal treatment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Tell me about Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy is a machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERRY BENEDICT emerges from a Town Car and, from his haircut to his smile to his pant-cuffs, he is effortless perfection. He is Vegas royalty, yet he denies eye contact to no man. He strides into his casino and, appearing behind a pillar, Linus follows him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He arrives at the Bellagio every day at two p.m. Same Town Car, same driver. Remembers every valet's name on the way in. Not bad for a guy worth three-quarters of a billion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open, and Terry Benedict steps out.     Linus watches from a craps table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Offices are upstairs. He works hard, hits the lobby floor at seven on the nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a balcony, Benedict stands overlooking the casino floor. His CASINO MANAGER approaches and they confer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spends three minutes on the floor with his casino manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All business. Benedict likes to know what's going on in his casinos. There's rarely an incident he doesn't know about or handle personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict works the room. He speaks to a Japanese High Roller in Japanese, to a Swiss in German, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spends a few minutes gladhanding the high rollers. He's fluent in Spanish, German and Italian, and he's taking Japanese lessons, getting pretty good at it. He's out by seven-thirty, when an assistant hands him a black portfolio. Contents: the day's take and new security codes. Then he heads to the restaurant. Indeed, as Benedict makes his exit, an assistant hands him a black portfolio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty and Linus watch the entrance:    No one enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him another ten seconds. Around the corner comes Benedict, carrying his black portfolio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I said:   a machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that portfolio contains the codes to all the cage doors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 3/30/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes after they've been changed, he's got 'em in hand. (beat) I'll tell you: you guys picked a helluva target. He is as smart and ruthless as they come. The last guy caught cheating here, Benedict not only sent him up for ten years, he got the bank to seize the guy's home and bankrupted --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- his brother-in-law's tractor dealership, I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't just go after your knees, he goes after your livelihood. And everyone-you- ever-met's livelihood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You suicidal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only in the morning. (beat) Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now comes the girl... if she comes in after he does, that means they're in a snit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's she come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The museum downstairs. She's the curator there. Wait... here she is. You'll like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty looks up as... ... a beautiful woman (the one Danny saw on Benedict's arm in the New York Times photo) appears. Elegantly dressed, a knockout, she moves very much in her own private space. And Rusty's face just about drops at the sight of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 3/30/01                     58A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if we can use her yet. I haven't even caught her name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks very certain about this, very certain and very upset) Her name is Tess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Construction continues into the wee hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A facsimile of the Bellagio vault sprouts into shape. Livingston fixes a security camera in a corner, then matches its image (of Frank staple-gunning floorboard into place) to a security tape of the real McCoy. On the other side of the garage, Turk and Virgil go to work on their newly-purchased vans, with wrenches and blow torches. Tishkoff recognizes a gasket Virgil handles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks familiar. Where'd you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off your Rolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny!   Tell 'em not to touch the Rolls! Overlooking the whole enterprise is Danny, grinning from ear to ear, happy in his work. He checks a stopwatch in his hand as... ... the false top to the cash cart before him flies open, revealing Yen within, his arms, legs and torso folded into a three-by-four foot space. He whips an air hose from his mouth and inhales deeply. Danny checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29:47.   Everything okay in there? Yen responds. Of course, Danny doesn't understand him. But Rusty does, appearing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what doesn't beat the shit out of being a circus performer? Danny turns to Rusty:    he looks very, very serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Rusty adjourn from the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me this isn't about her. Or I'll walk off the job right now. (off Danny's reaction) Tess. She's with Terry Benedict now. Tell me this isn't about screwing the guy who's screwing your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex-wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not.   About that.   Entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you needed a reason. Well, this is mine. (beat) When we started in this business, we had three rules. We weren't gonna hurt anybody. We weren't gonna steal from anybody didn't have it coming. And we were gonna play the game like we had nothing to lose. Well, I lost something. Someone. That's why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the problem: we're stealing two things now. And when push comes to shove, if you can't have both, which are you gonna choose? And remember: Tess doesn't divide eleven ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If things go to plan, I won't be the one who has to make that choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men stand quietly for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd she look by the way? Tess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen her happier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Radiant' is the word. Absolutely radiant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The painting hangs under a portrait lamp on a wall between a van Gogh and a Monet. At a distance, admiring it, are Tess, the SELLER and the seller's AIDE-DE-CAMP. A staff photographer and other personnel mill nearby. Off to the side, in a sharp blazer, Tess stands transfixed by the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He painted it in the summer of 1912, after the break-up with Fernande Olivier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must have put him through hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see the conflict. He makes her both erotic and grotesque. He's hopelessly drawn to her, and yet she drives him crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking his watch) Mr. Santaniello has an early flight. Do you think Mr. Benedict will be late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Benedict is never late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the double doors to the gallery swing open, and Terry Benedict enters, right on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 5/31/01

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He is elegant, beaming, commanding.    All that's missing is a blare of trumpets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all, Mr. Benedict. (greeting him) Allow me to introduce to you Mr. Jean Santaniello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Seller) Mr. Santaniello, I apologize if I kept you. I had to iron out a few issues with my fight promoter. I gave him an unlimited budget, and he exceeded it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand it's going to be a hell of a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess angles Benedict toward the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict moves toward the painting, and as he does he catches Tess in his glance, and his smile deepens. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magnificent! I've been following her for fifteen years now. At last I've made her a home. (to Tess) All the arrangements and so forth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done.   She's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not mine. She belongs to everyone who comes into my hotel. Isn't that right, Ms. Ocean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's lovely, isn't she? (as the Seller is confused; Benedict specifies painting) I can't be the only one who was after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only one who met my price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but this... You can't put a price on beauty. But I shouldn't philosophize. I own casinos, after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get a quick shot? Mr. Santaniello has a plane to catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess understands: she is not to be part of the photo. Benedict and the Seller pose together and... Flash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Seller exits with the Aide-De-Camp in tow. Benedict remains, enthralled by the painting. Tess appears beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that you like it. (beat) I have some bad news from the world of high fashion. It seems Mike Tyson will be wearing red on Saturday night. Red trunks with a white stripe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, as I recall, will be wearing a red Donna Karan? And when the TV cameras pick us up in the front row, that red dress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a charming man, but no one's going to be watching him when they can make a study of you. I've asked Paolo to find three or four things for you to try. I hope you're not too disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is, but she buries it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, smiles faintly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instinctively she leans in to kiss him.        He recoils so slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    We're alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets his eyes wander along the length of the ceiling, over all the eye-in-the-sky cameras hidden there. She follows his look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my hotels, there's always someone watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he kisses her anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances once more on the Picasso as he moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I do like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Tess remains, thinking:         he's rich, he's hands wooing, but is she happy? OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00                            65.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, elegant, tense. One table is operating only, in the corner, and at it Saul, as Lyman Zerga, furtively peels at the roll of Rolaids and slips one in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weak stomach, Mr. Zerga?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in weakness. It costs too much. I don't believe in questions, either.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This shuts the High Roller up fast. Saul looks up from the table, just perceptibly, to spot Terry Benedict, on his way in, right on schedule. He approaches the PIT BOSS by the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie.    Anything for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zerga, sir. Lyman Zerga. In the third position. Wishes to speak with you privately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Businessman of some kind, working mostly in Europe. He's very vague, but I asked around. Word is he deals primarily in arms. One of the biggest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zerga?    Never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.    That's why I don't doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's staying here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checked in two nights ago, sir. He's in the Mirador suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up.   Almost forty grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowing he can't duck this) Good for him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess Ocean sits in a booth and sips at a glass of wine and checks her watch: Benedict is late or very close to being so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ... when a pair of hands slips over her shoulders and starts to caress her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking at him) You're thirty seconds late. I was about to send out a search party... (recognizing the hands, she turns, stunned) Danny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing over her, grinning) Hello, Tess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrilled and petrified and stunned to see him, but outraged mostly) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of prison. You remember. The day I went for cigarettes and never came back. You must have noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't smoke. (as he sits) Don't sit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (but he does) They said I'd paid my debt to society.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, I never got a check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny smiles.    Tess stares daggers.

dialogues.speaker: TESS DANNY
dialogues.text: You can't stay.                   It's good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not wearing your ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sold it. And I don't have a husband. Or didn't you get the papers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My last day inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I'd write.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny reaches his hand (ringed) for hers (ringless), but she removes it from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny.   Go.   Now. Before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She freezes: Danny knows.       He smiles:   it's okay. to a passing waiter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his fingers two inches apart) Whiskey and -- (then one inch apart) -- whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing a great job curating the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vermeer is quite good. Simple but vibrant. Although his work definitely fell off as he got older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind you of anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I still get Monet and Manet confused. Which one married his mistress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   Manet had syphilis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They also painted occasionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know how many times I played this conversation out in my head the last two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it always go this poorly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds frustrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were never easy. (as she shrugs) Okay. I'll make this quick. I came here for you. I'm gonna get on with my life, and I want you with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a thief and a liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only lied about being a thief. But I don't do that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with someone now who doesn't have to make that kind of distinction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 03/20/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's very clear on both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.   Work on that for two years, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Year and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light smile from Tess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what your problem is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only have one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've met too many people like you. (then) I'm with Terry now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he make you laugh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't make me cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the table, Saul bets heavily for the bank. Benedict approaches, stands off to the right, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Saul, noticing his heavy bet) You don't want to get in the hole too heavy to this Benedict. A friend of mine once borrowed a hundred g's from the guy. Two months went by, Benedict hadn't heard from him, he calls my friend up, asks 'Where's my money?' I'll get to it when I get to it,' my friend says. Half hour later Benedict's in my friend's hotel room, dangling him off his 10th floor balcony by his feet. 'You gonna get to it now?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High Roller turns over a nine.     Saul wins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 03/20/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bank wins -- natural nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Weintraub.     How's everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh. They put too much grenadine in my Shirley Temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here I thought you were drinking vodka. (turning attention to Saul) Mr. Zerga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Benedict. I recognize you from the TV. You know, nine casinos out of ten, owner comes up in the middle of the hand to ask me what I want. I respect your waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the guest, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have to impose on your hospitality. Can you sit in for a hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to, Mr. Zerga, but the gaming board would feed me to my white tigers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a shame. You're the king of Vegas and you have to play craps in the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shame at all. Reminds me of my youth.

dialogues.speaker: CORNER
dialogues.text: Benedict and Saul are huddled in a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fight is Saturday, is it not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   I can get you seats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. Hand-to-hand combat doesn't interest me. I have a package arriving here Saturday evening. A black briefcase, standard size, the contents of which are very valuable to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be happy to put it in the house safe for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house safe is for brandy and grandmother's pearls. I'm afraid I need something more secure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can assure you, the house safe is utterly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his looks stops Benedict) I can assure you, Mr. Benedict, your generosity in this matter will not go overlooked. Now: what can you offer me besides the safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul's eyes are pure steel: he is not a man familiar with being denied. And Benedict recognizes that fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, the kind of people you steal things from, they have insurance to compensate them. They get made whole again. I had to leave New York to get away from what happened. How do I get my five years back, Danny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't. But what you can do is not throw away another five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know anything about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning in) Listen, you don't love me anymore, you want to make a life with someone else? Fine, I'll have to live with that. But not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spoken like a true ex-husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not joking, Tess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not laughing. (beat) You have to admit there's a conflict of interest when you give me advice about my love life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny exhales and leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But that doesn't mean I'm wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, and maybe part of her knows that he isn't. She looks down at his ring, somewhat wistful. He sees her looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember what I said to you when we first met?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said: you better know what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? Now? Because -- truly -- you should walk out the door if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry Benedict is hovering over them, fresh from his meeting with Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catching up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, meet my ex-husband...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending his hand) Danny Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it) Mr. Ocean. (to Tess) Forgive me for being late. A guest required my attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny was just walking through the restaurant and spotted me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was shocked myself.   Imagine the odds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Of all the gin joints in all the world...' (beat) You've been in prison until recently, isn't that right? How does it feel to be out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the same. Everything you want is still on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the human condition for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, Danny was just about to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say hello.   For old time's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay for a drink, if you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) -- I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence.    Benedict takes Tess's hand in his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then I don't imagine we'll be seeing you again, Mr. Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everything that happens in my hotels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I should put those towels back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The towels you can keep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, rises) Good seeing you, Tess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care, Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny goes.    When he's out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like lightning) Don't be.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE RESTAURANT
dialogues.text: MOVING WITH Danny as he exits, his fingers snapping, he saw the mist in Tess's eyes just now, he knows he's got a fighting chance with her, but what he does not know is... ... Linus is tailing him, ten steps back. He stops, glances back at the restaurant quizzically, then continues following Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody lights a match, this place is a powder keg. Basher sits on his bed, surrounded by combustibles, whittling and polishing a plastic explosive into an emerald shape. There's a KNOCK at the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: House cleaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes never leave his work) Just jumping into the shower, can you come back later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maid moves on, on TV:     A Reporter broadcasts live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here at the historic Paradiso Hotel and Casino, once the prize resort of Las Vegas, now seconds away from demolition...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just down the block from the Terry Benedict Trinity stands (for a few remaining moments) the edifice of the Paradiso, Reuben Tishkoff's bankrupted hotel-casino. A crowd has gathered to witness its destruction: Terry Benedict, for one, his finger on the button and his face in the spotlight; Tess another, standing (near)by her man; Danny, too, hidden within the masses, eyes fixed on his ex; and Linus, who keeps a steady bead on Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and here's Reuben Tishkoff, former owner of the Paradiso, come to bid farewell to his fabled resort and wish Terry Benedict all the best with his future plans for the property... Terry greets Reuben before the TV cameras and newspaper reporters, and everyone's smiling and shaking hands, but behind those smiles and under their breaths...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go shit in your mouth. Tess, her eyes roaming the crowd, finds a pair staring back at her: Danny's. She holds his glance a moment -- long enough for both Linus and Benedict to notice -- before turning away, to... ... Benedict, who puts his public smile back on and steps up to a podium alongside MIKE TYSON and LENNOX LEWIS, and together they all put their hands on "the plunger" and Benedict leans into a microphone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope there's as much dynamite in the Paradiso as there will be in this Saturday's fight. ... and -- WHOOMPH -- the PLUNGER comes down and -- write your own onomatopoeia here -- the PARADISO IMPLODES. Reuben wipes a tear from his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'bye, honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Paradiso crumbles outside his window, the lights and TV in his room flicker and go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he scrambles out the door, making sure to post a "Do Not Disturb" sign...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday day is yours. Do whatever you like with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM ABOVE, SLOWLY DESCENDING: Ten of our eleven (Basher is missing) surround the model of the three casinos. Rusty leads everyone in a run-down of the heist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call is at five-thirty. Makeup and costume. Saul's package arrives at seven-fifteen, and Linus grabs our codes. All goes well there and we're a go. Seven- thirty Virgil and Turk deliver Yen and we're committed. From that point, we have thirty minutes to blow the power or he suffocates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We DESCEND ONTO the miniature of the vault, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM ABOVE, DESCENDING STILL: This is the Real Deal. The Bellagio vault. A clock reads: 8:03.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once the electricity goes, all entry points to the vault and its elevator will automatically lock down for two minutes. That's when we make our move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guards wheel in a cash cart and leave it in the vault's center and march out again, closing the thick metal door behind them. When the vault LOCKS CLICK... ... We STOP DESCENDING, just above the cash cart. There is silence for a spell, the lights flicker out, then... ... the false top of the cart springs open, revealing Yen within, folded neatly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He inhales deeply, then slowly unspools himself from the cash cart until, at last, he crouches atop it. He takes in the room: vacant and silent. Except for Rusty, who walks right by him, incongruously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay: they've put you in the middle of the room, far from everything. You have to get from here to the door without touching the floor. What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WIDER ANGLE reveals we're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bellagio vault has been fully reproduced here, and what we've been watching has been a trial run. Ten of the eleven (Turk and Virgil in guard costumes, Basher is still missing) watch from offstage, like a film crew watching a dress rehearsal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fin says he shorts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it a sawbuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a dead squat, Yen leaps, hands first, from the cash cart to a ledge five yards away, and grips it safely with both hands without touching the floor. From this position, he'll inch his way to a counter, then, to the door... Frank pays up. Behind him, a DOOR SLAMS, and he turns to see Basher, at last. Sniffing the air, he double-takes -- Basher's covered head-to-toe in sewage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (and he's not happy) We're in deep shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus hoses Basher off, his accent angry and thick as he spits out water and the story of his afternoon and if nobody understands a word he's saying, that's okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The damn demo crew didn't use a coaxial lynch to back the mainline! Onioned the mainframe couplet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reuben leans into Livingston...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand any of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll explain later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blew the backup grid one by one! Like dominoes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he hardly understands this either) Basher. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A cabal of city engineers investigates subterranean fuse boxes, and Basher tails them, hiding near a waterfall of effluent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did exactly what I planned to do. Only they did it by accident. Now they know their weakness. And they're fixing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ECHOING FOOTSTEP draws the attention of the city engineers, and Basher retreats into the waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basher towels off his hair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So unless we decide to do this job in Reno, we're screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny rises and paces, frustrated.      He's come too far things to go awry now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny keeps pacing; Rusty hangs his head and thinks; Basher dries his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an idea occurs to him) We could use a pinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny stops; Rusty looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- is a pinch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scientists demonstrate the pinch, a lithium wire in a glass vacuum tube the size of a small refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pinch is the equivalent of a cardiac arrest for any broad-band electrical circuitry. Or better yet: A pinch is a bomb... but without the bomb. Every time a nuclear weapon detonates, it unleashes an electromagnetic pulse which shuts down any power source within its vicinity. That tends not to matter in most cases because the nuclear weapon destroys everything you might need power for anyway. Now a pinch creates a similar electromagnetic pulse, but without the headache of mass destruction and death. So instead of Hiroshima, you get the Seventeenth Century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could a pinch take out the power of an entire city? Like, I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Las Vegas? (beat) But there's only one pinch in the world big enough to handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Rusty trade a look:        They have their answ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then balefully) Pasadena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights hit a sign: "Cal Tech. HIGH-SECURITY AREA. KEEP OUT." A white VAN SHOOTS PAST it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turk and Virgil man the front seats as Danny, Basher, Yen and Linus huddle in the back. Basher and Yen both prepare equipment for their raid: hooks and a rope for Yen, a small blowtorch and a drill for Basher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Basher and Yen) You two ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod and, with Danny, start out the van's rear door. Linus starts to follow but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The van door slams in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny picks a lock, then he, Yen, and Basher disappear into the lab's interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus twiddles his thumbs, tired of being seated at the kids' table. Meanwhile, up front, another Mensa meeting has been called to order...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    Nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    Eighteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evel Knievel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!   Okay, your turn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Co-sign squared over .0455.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Co-sign squared over .0415.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .04-five-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know your string theory, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: After a spell of silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom told me she loves me more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me she was going to tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can be heard WRESTLING. Linus has had enough.     He sneaks out the van's back door without the Malloys hearing him.

dialogues.speaker: AT PERIMETER DOOR
dialogues.text: Linus sulks along the laboratory's perimeter, finds the door Danny pick-locked, and disappears inside. A moment passes. A moment passes. And the next door opens, and Danny, Basher, and Yen appear, pinch in hand -- they've succeeded. They weave a path to the van...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turk and Virgil are still wrestling as the trio appears. Danny, Basher and Yen pile in the back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got it.   Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turk floors it, and they're off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turk brakes, and they're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Linus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone realizes:    he's not here.   Just then: SIRENS and ALARMS and lights come to life.      Uh-oh. Danny spins to look out the back of the van, Basher by his side. His eyes scan the compound, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the lab, and its beveled-glass stairwell. Linus scrambles up its steps, a flight ahead of a duo of chasin guards. As he ascends out of sight... Danny shifts his focus to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other side of the building, and two more guards arriving on the roof and moving toward the staircase: Linus will be trapped.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Danny, Basher, and Yen squat side-by-side-by-side, watching all this. Yen makes a colorful observation about Linus's predicament; of course, no one understands it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us should help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (who speaks Danny's mind) Then there'll be two of us who need saving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows where we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both sets of guards appear on the rooftop, and find no Linus between them -- he's disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd he go?

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Danny and Basher slowly turn: Turk and Virgil crouch inches behind them, wanting to spectate as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Danny's look) What? (then, realizing their goof, to his brother, remonstratively) Would you -- shouldn't someone be behind the wheel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second-story WINDOW EXPLODES as a desk chair flies through it, followed shortly by Linus who leaps onto a steel-mesh overhang running alongside the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, back it up, back it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgil leaps into the driver's seat, shifts into reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus runs along the overhang, then leaps down, onto the reversing van, and rolls along its roof and down its windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: B131 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THROUGH the windshield: Virgil jabs his thumb over his shoulder: get in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appearing from the rear doors) C'mon, c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus scrambles back over the van, and Danny and Yen pull him in. Virgil hits the gas for a quick getaway, but he does so before the rear doors are closed, and one of them slams shut right on Yen's hand -- CRUNCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it hurtles away. Basher tends to Yen, cradling his hand, and Danny stares down Linus, breathless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say stay in the van, you stay in the van, got it? 'Cause you lose focus for one second in this game, and someone gets hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's had just about enough of Danny's shit) I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue staring daggers at one another as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van pulls away into the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fight night in Las Vegas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming lanes of the I-15 reflect bumper-to-bumper steel; planes in the air are stacked for five miles over the desert; even Gila monsters below seem Vegas-bound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...   people are flooding in from all   over the country to see what has   been dubbed the 'Fight to End All   Fights'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIM LAMPLEY broadcasts live from a mobbed Strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and even though it's still five hours 'til the opening bell, the energy here is fever-pitched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every table is in play, every seat filled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bellagio's CASINO MANAGER (the one Linus spied with Benedict before) checks in with his watchers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston has moved A/V operations into Lyman Zerga's suite. As he scours the same images the watchers downstairs do, he eavesdrops on their communications through his headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over Livingston's headset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotton couldn't be taller.

dialogues.speaker: IN MIRADOR SUITE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Lost in the luxury his role dictates, Saul floats in a full-sized Jacuzzi and chews on a hundred dollar cigar; Reuben, meanwhile, paces the floor, nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they? That's what I want to know. Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Lyman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself, mocking "Lyman")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'They'll be here.' Thanks a lot, Fidel.

dialogues.speaker: AT LIVINGSTON'S CONSOLE
dialogues.text: Punching up a new set of views from the Eye In The Sky, Livingston thrusts forward, alarmed by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty keeps watch on the hotel's side entrance.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He glances at his watch, then outside again as the white van arrives, dropping off only Linus and Danny, who slaps the van's roof before it pulls away. As Danny and Linus enter the lobby, Rusty falls into step with them, exchanging a smile with Danny but not Linus, he still looks chastised from the car-trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riding up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys have a nice trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty, smiling, looks to Linus, glowering, then to Danny. Before Danny can explain the doors part at the Mirador Suite, where Livingston greets them urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mug-shot of Danny, complete with vital information: height, weight, criminal history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been red-flagged. It means the moment you step on the casino floor, they'll be watching you. Like hawks. Hawks with video cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pall falls over the room: this is more than a problem, this is disastrous. Only SAUL dares make a noise, HUMMING and SPLASHING in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul:   time to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Lyman) It's time when I say it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear HIM JUMP-TO-IT out of the tub...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (himself again) I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to Danny) You have any idea how this happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Danny can answer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. He's been chasing Benedict's woman. Got into a real snarl with him two nights ago. (off Danny's look) I was tailing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Linus can answer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. (he and Danny hold a stare) I knew you couldn't leave Tess alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Tess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex-wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appearing in a bathrobe) Tess is here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes still on Danny) I'm sorry. I didn't know if it would sting you, but it did. (the most difficult words he's ever had to say) You're out, Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that or we shut down right now. His involvement puts us all at risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Rusty face off, furious with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't your call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it my call. When you put her ahead of us. You made it mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny stares daggers at Rusty. But he can see: everyone in the room is on Rusty's side. Defeated, he stalks out of the room, onto a balcony, but not without staring down Linus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, but... he can't just be out. Who's gonna take his place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty turns to Linus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid, you up for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus's eyes drift to Danny outside -- whatever acrimony he felt before, he never meant to kick Danny off the job. He nods, half-cocksure/half-scared-pissless: he's up for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Livingston) Find everyone else. Let 'em know the change in plan. Curtain goes up at seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston exits. Everyone else in the room staggers about, like witnesses after an execution. Rusty steps out onto the balcony, perhaps to console Danny, but (as Linus watches them from inside) their words cannot be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess is with Benedict now? (as nobody responds) She's too tall for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess, readying herself for the big evening, meets her own glance in a dressing mirror, then spots Benedict in its reflection, pacing the bedroom behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Yes. Yes. No. Very much no. (beat) Then inform Mr. Levin he'll find a better view of the fight in front of his television. Surely he must have H.B.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging up, Benedict approaches her, puts his hands on her shoulders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him in the mirror.    His glance in it, turns from her to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riding down, Terry Benedict checks his watch.     The elevator doors open and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he steps onto his casino's floor, the king of Las Vegas. The time is 7:00. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00                              9

dialogues.speaker: ON BALCONY OVERLOOKING CASINO FLOOR
dialogues.text: Benedict meets his casino Manager, according to schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any sign of Ocean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not   in a couple hours. You want him   out? I can bounce him from the   state for parole violation if you   like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a guy on him. He's here for a reason. I'd like to know what it is. But if he comes anywhere near Tess, take it to the next level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruiser? Benedict nods, goes on his way.

dialogues.speaker: AT CASINO ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Saul, as Lyman Zerga, stands ramrod straight, looking through sliding glass doors out at the valet station. From behind, Terry Benedict approaches, two security guards walking half a pace behind him. Saul spots him in the glass's reflection; he does not turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zerga. It's a very busy night for me. Are we on schedule?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no reason to suspect otherwise. My couriers should be here momentarily. A beat as Benedict studies Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a nice evening. Shall we wait outside? OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00                              9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict and Saul emerge, guards positioned around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over STATIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   We're a go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white, unmarked van pulls in from the street and races up to the curb where Saul and Benedict wait. Turk Malloy gets out the passenger's side, a briefcase handcuffed to his wrist, as Virgil comes around from the driver's side, both of them dressed in their bodyguard suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zerga.   A gift from Mr. Hesse. Turk extends the briefcase to Saul, so that they both clasp the handle, as Virgil produces a key, unlocks the cuff on Turk's wrist, transfers it to Saul's, clamps it shut, and hands Saul the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Friedrich, Gunther. He turns, nods to Benedict, and they retreat into the hotel, the security guards and Malloys flanking them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank deals blackjack to a full table. His eyes gaze past his players to Saul, the guards and Benedict passing by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he busts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookin' like a bad night for the house. MOVING WITH Benedict as he spies out of the corner of his eye Danny, lurking at a slot machine. To one of his guards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Mr. Walsh. Tell him Mr. Ocean's in the west slots.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The guard goes, and Benedict continues with Saul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I can't allow my private security personnel inside the casino cages. I hope you don't mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul turns to dismiss Virgil and Turk when... ... passing by, on his way to a sports betting window, an old RACETRACK DENIZEN happens past this cabal and, worse yet, happens to recognize Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul?   Saul Bloom, is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul does his best to ignore the man. But even Benedict notices: this guy seems to know Lyman Zerga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul, it's me. Bucky Buchanan, remember? From Saratoga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last Saul turns to face this man, with shark's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friedrich, Gunther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An order: dispose of this man. Virgil and Turk pick up the Denizen by his elbows and haul him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Benedict... (gesturing to the cage; re: his briefcase-cuff) Please: I have never enjoyed the touch of steel to my skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They proceed.

dialogues.speaker: AT SLOTS
dialogues.text: Danny sits in a row of octogenarians, all vacantly dropping $1 coins and pulling levers. As he watches Saul and Benedict disappear into the cage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DING! DING! DING! DING! Four cherries. Danny smiles, a big winner, but he's got bigger pots to win tonight. He steers a neighboring senior citizen (blind as a bat) to his slot machine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops, you won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... then slips away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus stands dressed in a sharp, conservative suit -- a far cry from the threadbare thief in Chicago. Rusty circles him, inspecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you gonna put your hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus clasps them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus goes for his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the pockets, either. And don't touch your tie. Look at me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That how you gonna stand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus shifts his balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong again. I ask you a question, you have to think of the answer, where you gonna look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death. You look down, they know you're lying --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and up they know you don't know the truth. Don't use three words when one will do, don't shift your eyes, look always at your mark but don't stare, be specific but not memorable, funny but don't make him laugh, he's gotta like you then forget you the moment you've left his sight, and for God's sakes whatever you do, don't under any circumstances --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rust, can you come here a sec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wandering off) Sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus is left utterly bewildered, a thousand commandments to remember and fifteen minutes to remember them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turk and Virgil's white van whips around a corner and shoots inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of which, importantly, we never see the exterior, just an air freshener hanging from the rearview mirror... The white VAN SCREECHES to a halt inches from Basher who stands ready beside the pinch (and the now-gutted and dismantled mockup of the Bellagio vault) and faster than a NASCAR pit crew Basher, Turk and Virgil load the pinch into the white van's rear and before you can say "electromagnetic pulse" the VAN SCREECHES back out of the warehouse fully loaded. The time is 7:16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is empty save for a large table. Saul places his briefcase on it, adjusts its numbered combination locks, and opens it. Inside the case:    five rows of glittering emeralds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're very beautiful.   A gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul stares at him:     none of your fucking business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you lift them out, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul lifts the velvet tray out of the case, and Benedict pats down the case's interior. Saul replaces the tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Mr. Zerga. I acknowledge that the case does not contain any dangerous or illicit material. I further agree to take custody of your case for a twenty-four hour period to store in our secured vault. While I cannot permit you to accompany the case to the vault...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insurance, for one. Security, another. And I don't trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a KNOCK at the door, and Walsh the casino manager enters. He speaks low in Benedict's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put two plainclothes on Ocean. He's at the keno bar now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh nods, and Benedict turns back to Saul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zerga, this is Mr. Walsh, my casino manager. If you will allow, he will arrange for your briefcase to be stored inside our vault while you watch on a security monitor. (beat) Those are my terms. Yes or no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul and Benedict eyeball each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave me no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul unlocks the cuff from his wrist. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white van slows enough to unload Virgil and Turk, changed into waiter uniforms, and they hurry a table- clothed room service cart inside as Basher pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RISING FROM a spotless pair of wingtips shifting side-to- side, OVER hands flexing and stretching, UP TO Linus Caldwell. He keeps an eye on the cage door, waiting for Benedict to appear, as he tries anything to shake out his nerves. Then, from a discreet earpiece he wears, comes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep breaths.     You'll do fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathes deep)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sweat, kid. You're a rock. (as Linus smiles, feeling good about himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus's smile disappears as he continues to bounce. There's a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty checks through the peephole, then ushers in Turk and Virgil in costume with their room service cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who ordered the penne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston raises a hand, and as Turk serves him his plate, Virgil whips off the cart's tablecloth: underneath it's the false-lid cash cart. Rusty turns to a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In it, Yen finishes bandaging his busted hand and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat and Slim sit before their monitors, feet kicked up, as behind them Walsh, Benedict, and Saul enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our security center, where we oversee all gaming in the casino as well as our vault. You'll be able to monitor your briefcase from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh, finding Fat and Slim as they are, coughs; the two watchers leap immediately to their feet. Benedict checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let me keep you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zerga...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Benedict takes his leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus... you're up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus nods, shakes out his hands some more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep breaths, deep breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and here comes Benedict, exiting the cage just as his assistant arrives with his portfolio. As he turns toward the restaurant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Benedict...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (presents proper identification) Sheldon Wills. Nevada Gaming Commission. Could I have two minutes of your time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict sighs -- his evening's been sidetracked enough already -- but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.   Anything for the N.G.C.

dialogues.speaker: AT KENO BAR
dialogues.text: Danny watches Benedict escort Linus toward the blackjack tables, unaware that TWO PLAINCLOTHES SECURITY GOONS watch him from across the bar, and when he turns in their direction, they look away, acting incognito, but it's not them he's turning toward... ... it's Tess, rounding a corner toward the restaurant. Danny jumps to his feet, throws a tip on the bar, and goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time is 7:27. Yen tucks himself into the cash cart's hidden compartment with a slim oxygen tank for company. Meanwhile, Rusty drills Virgil and Turk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay: when do you make the deposit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until we get your signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. What do we look like: a couple of peckerwood jackasses or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning his attention to Yen, squeezed into the cart) Amazing: how's it feel? You alright? (as Yen nods) Want something to read? Magazine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the tangle of limbs, a middle finger protrudes to show Rusty what he can do with a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm counting down.    Thirty minutes of breathing time starts... now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On "now" a RUNNING CLOCK APPEARS ON-SCREEN, descending from 29:59. It will REMAIN there for the duration of the pre-pinch heist, jumping at times BETWEEN SCENES. Rusty seals Yen inside the cash cart, then gives the top a tug: it's shut tight. As Virgil redresses it with the tablecloth, Turk snatches back Livingston's penne on the way to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get no tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and counting. MOVING WITH Benedict and Linus into the Pit Boss's station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It only came to our attention this morning, Mr. Benedict. Apparently he has a record longer than my arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he is who you say he is. (hailing a PIT BOSS) Charlie. Call over Ramon Escalante.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, Mr. Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict and Linus wait, side-by-side. While Linus does his best to play it cool, Benedict dips into his portfolio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An overhead view of Benedict as he pulls out the combination to the vault, reads it, then buries it in his jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you make it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head blocked the last two numbers. (into his microphone) We missed it, Linus. You gotta grab the combination yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus half-nods in response, and Benedict notices. Suspicious of the young man, he decides to test him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You new at the commission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been there about two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Hal Lindley over there. You work with him at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause; will he pass?) Not since he died last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes.    The Pit Boss returns with Frank in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Escalante. Would you come with us, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's better if we talked off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus and Benedict lead Frank away.       As they pass an elevator... ... its doors open, revealing Turk and Virgil, dressed now as security guards, pushing out the false-lid cash cart. They leave behind a pile of dishes, waiter uniforms, a tablecloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and counting. A MAITRE D' scours his reservations list, then peers up to find Reuben Tishkoff approaching, on either side of him two gorgeous young women, all blonde hair and breasts and legs, women who wouldn't give Hefner the time of day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Tishkoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Marcel. My nieces and I would like a table. Something quiet before the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can put you at 19 in just a couple minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick as you can. (re: the girls) The meter's running here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maitre d' turns to his next customer:         Tess. course, merits a table instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Miss Ocean.    Right this way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reuben can't help but stare as Tess passes by. His eyes linger a little too long and a little too low...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reuben pivots; it's Danny, and he strolls past Reuben and his lady friends and into the restaurant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to keep your tongue in your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked to see Danny; thinks he's off the job, but covering) Yeah, pal, well only if you take your thumb out of your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Reuben gets brushed from behind by the two Plainclothes Goons following Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged) Hey: you have any idea who I think I am?

dialogues.speaker: AT TESS'S USUAL TABLE
dialogues.text: Just as she's sitting, Danny approaches.       She goes straight at him, apoplectic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny:    No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just be a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having you thrown out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts past him; he grabs her arm to keep her, and she wheels on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're up to something, Danny. What? And don't say you came here for me. You're pulling a job, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, know this: no matter what it is, you won't win me back. I can't afford it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came to say good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This surprises Tess, and, truth be told, saddens her; she studies him a moment, unsure of what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... then... good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny starts for her cheek, stops to see if it's alright with her -- she, sad-eyed, does not recoil -- and then gently kisses it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny leaves her.       Tess watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already missing him) Good-bye, Danny.

dialogues.speaker: AT RESTAURANT'S ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Danny runs smack into the Plainclothes Goons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ocean. Mr. Benedict would like to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resignedly, these men are much too big to tangle with) I thought he might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Plainclothes Goons escort Danny away, right past Reuben who frowns, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands at attention before Linus and Benedict. Linus, straddling a desk, takes a beeper off his belt when it pinches him. Benedict checks his watch: the fight's opening bell is growing closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your cooperation, Mr. Escalante. (as Frank nods, not at all) Or should I call you Mr. Catton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Frank bristles, tries not to let it show.   Linus pulls out a Xeroxed mug shot and bio of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are Frank Catton? Formerly of the Tropicana, the Desert Inn and the New York State penitentiary system?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Frank remains quiet) Your silence suggests you don't refute that. (to Benedict) Mr. Benedict, I'm afraid you've been employing an ex-convict. As you know, the N.G.C. strictly forbids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Goddamn cracker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause; he can't believe he just heard that) Pardon me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leering at Linus, simmering) You heard me. Just 'cause a black man tries to earn a decent wage in this state...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That has nothing to do with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over him, ranting) ... some cracker cowboy like you's gotta kick him out on the street. Want me to jump down, turn around, pick a bale of cotton, won't let me deal cards, might as well call it whitejack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) I resent your implication that race has anything to do with this. (to Benedict) Now, as I was saying, the Nevada Gaming Commission strictly forbids the employment of the colored... (whoops) ... I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does it: Frank attacks Linus, lunging at the man, and as Benedict steps in to separate the two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 3/30/01

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ... Linus's hand dips into his tuxedo jacket and withdraws the vault combination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I'm cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Linus) You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
