dialogues.text: (hearing this) He's got it. (into his mike) Virgil, Turk: deliver your package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guards stand sentry outside the cage door. Virgil and Turk move up with their cash cart, and when Virgil reaches for his keycard... it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, I think... Jesus.    I lost my card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards frown at him.     A SECURITY OFFICER approache

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... Jesus! I lost my keycard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (and this, he knows, will get this guard fired) Okay.   Leave the cart. Go find it. (to one of the sentries) Take this cart inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sentry nods, swipes his keycard, and enters with the cash cart. Turk and Virgil hesitate a moment to watch it enter, then hurry off. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a monitor: The sentry pushes the cart down a cage corridor. On another: Saul's briefcase is escorted by another guard to the vault elevator. On another: Danny is escorted inside the cage by the Plainclothes Goons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beginning to sweat this a bit, nerves overtaking him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: ON MONITORS
dialogues.text: The yen-filled cash cart joins Saul's briefcase on the elevator. PULL OUT to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my cue. (as he exits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give Basher the go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bash, what's your status?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: driving the white van, listening to a books-on-tape of Jane Eyre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning Bronte down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to yell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm there. And he SCREECHES to a halt on the parking structure's top level. Vegas can be seen in every direction. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and counting. Benedict exits the casino Manager's office with Linus and Frank. Benedict hails two GUARDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please show this man off the premises. (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't step foot in my casino again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he's led away, over his shoulder, to Linus)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cracker. Benedict checks his watch again:    he's really running late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wills, if you don't mind... (as Linus forgets to respond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. They start toward the exit.   But halfway there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My beeper.   I'm sorry.   I forgot it. Benedict hesitates: He's in an enormous hurry now, he's behind schedule -- he hates being behind schedule -- but leaving even a member of the Gaming Commission alone in his cage is a security risk. One glace at the cameras all about and he decides to risk it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to get back out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.   Enjoy the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his hand, then hurrying away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Linus smiles after him, withdrawing the page of combinations he lifted off the man. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and counting. The Guards show Frank out.     Frank tries to tip them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, fellas. ... but they snarl at him before returning inside.   Fran smiles and goes on his way, his job complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sits opposite two Plainclothes Goons in absolute silence, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much longer do you think Mr. Benedict will be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a few minutes more. He scans the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cameras in this room, huh? Don't want anyone seeing what happens here? The Goons say nothing.   Danny checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not coming, is he? The Goons look at each other; Danny has called their bluff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is? There's a KNOCK at the door, and the Goons smile: Danny's about to find out who. One Goon rises to usher in... ... the BRUISER, come to beat the shit out of Danny Ocean. The guy's at least six-six, three hundred pounds, but it's not his size that draws attention, it's his teeth...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ... or the lack thereof; the Bruiser doesn't hold a single incisor, molar or bicuspid in his mouth. Gum city. And there's something really terrifying about the sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess Mr. Benedict didn't like me talking to his girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Goons shake their heads. Danny smiles at the Bruiser, and the Bruiser snarls back, showing off those gums. He rolls up his shirtsleeves, itching to tear a hole in this man. The Goons head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna step outside now. Leave you two alone to talk things over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Goons exit. Danny and the Bruiser face off. And as Danny opens his mouth to speak, Bruiser's fist flashes out and knocks him down. Danny rises, wiping a little blood from his lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Bruiser, not 'til later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Danny.    I -- I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'okay. (shaking it off) How's the wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pregnant again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we better get to work.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE INTERROGATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Standing guard outside, the Goons hear PUNCHES and GROANS from inside as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Danny climbs onto Bruiser's shoulders and pushes through the ceiling rafters, groaning every time Bruiser slaps his fist into his hand. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guard wheels in the Yen-filled cash cart, parks it in a station next to its twin, then -- as an afterthought -- plants Saul's briefcase right on top if it -- clunk -- an unforeseen obstacle to Yen's escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul witnesses this, too, and stifles a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that satisfy you, Mr. Zerga?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm very satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Slim) Close it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor, the vault door closes, but Saul looks anything but satisfied. He's sweaty, his mouth's so dry he can't swallow, and he keeps patting down his pockets for his Rolaids, without finding them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright, sir?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: as he circumspectly approaches the vault-elevator door, checking up and down hallways for guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a monitor, Linus comes into view...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost there, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and Saul spots him, but so does Fat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and Saul can't handle the suspense: He grips his arm and groans and this is no ulcer problem, this is a full- cardiac, and Walsh, Fat, and Slim all attend to him, their backs turned as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Linus hurries to the elevator, punching Benedict's combination into a keypad. The elevator doors open for him. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00                              1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston punches a few keys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to video now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Saul and his heart attack hold the spotlight, a security monitor flips from a shot of Linus entering the elevator to a Livingston-fed videotape of an empty lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Saul passes out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call for a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus immediately reaches up to the elevator's ceiling, rips down its panel to reveal a trap door. As he starts to push it open... ... a hand yanks it free from above.    It's Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't really think I was gonna sit this one out, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, didn't you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do now. He reaches down and pulls Linus, wide-eyed, up to the roof of the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boxers enter the ring before a full, cheering house. Benedict and Tess find their ringside seats, a row in front of Reuben and his "nieces."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty approaches the sentry on duty at the cage door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone called for a doctor? OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny rips off his jacket and shirt to expose a rappellin line wrapped around his torso. Linus does the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawlspace. And I had to give away a couple mil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about -- I mean, that whole thing with Rusty... Danny just smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: A192 FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Earlier that night, just after Rusty kicked Danny off the job. As Linus watches from inside, deaf to their conversation, blind to their expressions, Danny and Rusty confer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think the kid bought it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I think Reuben bought it, and he knew we were screwing around. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Caldwell threw me into the pool first time. Least I could do is give his kid a push.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you make me go through all this? Why not just tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where's the fun in that? (starting toward elevator shaft ladder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon: Yen's got about three minutes of air left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: B192 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Danny leads Linus down and around the elevator and side- by-side they crawl onto the bottom of the elevator, gripping the undercarriage of the lift to keep from falling. Meanwhile, we DESCEND QUICKLY DOWN the shaft, just to illustrate how very high up they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty, playing doctor, inspects Saul. At the same time, he inspects a monitor: the vault door closing with the Yen-filled cash cart and Saul's briefcase inside. Rusty stops, listens to Saul's chest, then drops his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh, Fat and Slim all bow their heads.     At the door, two paramedics arrive with a stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too late, guys.   He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first paramedic turns to his partner and admonishes him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Turk) I told you to hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Danny and Linus work, affixing suction-cupped anchors to their rappelling lines...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you like tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyson or Lewis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fight...? (as Danny nods) Lewis. (as Danny shoots him a look) You like Tyson? (as Danny nods) How strongly do you feel about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking for action?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I'd go in for a buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A buck it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're ready, poised at the top, looking into the abyss of an elevator shaft scattered with infrared sensors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mike) Livingston, we're set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty leads the "paramedics" out, with "dead" Saul on their gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mike) Livingston, we're set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hearing this, into his mike) Basher, we're set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fixing the pinch atop his van) Just give me a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a minute. Yen's gonna pass out in thirteen seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then give me thirteen seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Basher leaps down to hook up the pinch's wires to his van's engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opening BELL RINGS -- round one. The fighters break from their corners, feinting, jabbing... Sitting ringside: Benedict looks at Tess and smiles as she winces at the first sharp blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peering down into blackness, Danny and Linus prepare to let go any moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever rappelled before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.   You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basher finishes preparations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mike) Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over earpiece) Then hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basher flips the switch. BOOM! A quick TREMOR, then stillness. He picks a point on the horizon, like Babe Ruth, and suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: HIGH ABOVE LAS VEGAS
dialogues.text: whole blocks of lights disappear.   Casinos vanishing one by-one.

dialogues.speaker: FLAMINGO
dialogues.text: Every pink light vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: BELLAGIO
dialogues.text: The fountain goes flaccid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... two, three...

dialogues.speaker: NEW YORK, NEW YORK
dialogues.text: The roller coaster stops dead; its passengers keep their arms raised, not sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: MGM GRAND GARDEN ARENA
dialogues.text: Both fighters move in simultaneously, sweat flying, both reach back, both going for the lights-out power cut to the jaw, when... lights out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... four, five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blip -- out go the infrared sensors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! And he and Linus lean forward and fall...

dialogues.speaker: HURTLING WITH DANNY AND LINUS
dialogues.text: DOWN the elevator shaft. Upside down, heads curled, and all we hear is the WHOOSH of their bodies in motion and the WHIRL of their CORDS UNCOILING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... six, seven.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, looking STRAIGHT DOWN, the ground is rising up fast to meet them, a flat slab of gray concrete -- fifty feet, forty feet, thirty feet, twenty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... eight, nine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And SNAP -- the CORDS reach their full extension, and Danny and Linus bounce up, watching the floor recede.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaahhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, lights come up again, first at the Mirage, then the MGM, gradually approaching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming to a rest about ten feet from the floor, Danny quickly pulls a slim blade and slashes the two coils straight across. He and Linus go tumbling to the floor as their drop lines recoil lightning fast to their elevator anchors, just before... ... the infrared lights go back on-line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights suddenly flash back on, revealing... ... both fighters standing, and Tyson takes advantage of Lewis's disorientation and throws a sucker punch to his jaw. Down goes Lewis, and up goes the crowd, roaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... One, two, three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict makes a quick survey; the arena is apoplectic from the blackout-knockout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01                                1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He cranes his neck, looking around the room, surveying his empire: he smells a rat. His eyes fall on Reuben behind him, but Reuben just shrugs: "I didn't pull the plug."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) The first goddamn round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the lights are back on, and Basher observes his achievement with great pride, his job complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viva Las Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus and Danny arise from where they've fallen, clutching their heads and rubbing bruises. Danny doesn't recover as quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but you're sweet to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights are just flickering on here when... ... the false lid of the cash cart thrust upward slightly. It's Yen trying to get out, out of air and only now alert to Saul's heavy case resting atop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston watches this on his monitors, just coming back on, his finger poised on a play button, as Frank comes in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One second. (a look at him) I thought you got kicked out?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Frank shrugs. Suddenly one of the monitors aligns itself, and Livingston presses play.

dialogues.speaker: ON MONITOR A
dialogues.text: Overhead security-cam view of the vault corridor: the three Uzi guards stand idly, on duty. And of the vault itself: Yen trying to get out of the cash cart.

dialogues.speaker: ON MONITOR B
dialogues.text: Overhead security-cam view of the vault corridor: the three Uzi guards stand idly, on duty... and in totally different positions. Of the vault: no cash cart, but no Zerga briefcase, no Yen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This tape's from last night.   Same guards, same...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes fixing on Saul's briefcase pushing closer to the edge of the cash cart as Yen tries to free himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is abuzz with activity. The monitors here flicker back on, too, displaying the images from monitor B, but every watcher in the place is watching a table because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the floor is going nuts. After the ten seconds of darkness, all bets are off. Some players doubled-down during the blackout, others miraculously halved their bets. Consequently, Livingston's video feed switch goes unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Linus pry open the elevator doors and squeeze out. Just beyond the next doorway stand... ... three UZI-CARRYING GUARDS, hovering outside the vault door and wondering what the hell just happened to the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen continues to push up on the cash cart lid, and the more he pushes, the more Saul's briefcase slides off. Yen stretches his hand out to grab it, but it's slid beyond his reach, to the edge of falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Uzi-Carrying Guards turn their backs to the elevator shaft... ... and Linus and Danny appear in the doorway; they both snap gas pellets and slide them into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffing something) Jesus, Ron, was that you?

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE VAULT CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Linus and Danny wait, Danny silently mouthing a three- count before... THUD, THUD, THUD. They peer around the corridor to find... All three Uzi-carrying guards lie unconscious on the ground. Linus starts in, Danny holds him back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. (a beat; another beat; then) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Linus enter, waving the faint remnants of the gas from their noses, tiptoeing past the guards' bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Yen made it out okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul's briefcase inches closer to falling off the cash ca which of course would trigger the floor sensor and termin this heist here and now. Yen's hand stretches farther out grab it, pushing up just a little more on the false lid until... ... the briefcase tumbles toward the floor... ... but not before Yen snags the handcuff chain attached it and swings it round. He's got it. That threat over, he throws open the cash cart lid and takes the biggest breat of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus punches in the code for the door to the vault anteroom (the one he stole from Benedict). He steps back as it slides open, revealing -- -- the vault door:     it is sleek and immense and impregnable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jaw dropping) Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a Chinese man with a hundred sixty million dollars behind that door. Let's get him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny takes a flat hand and slaps the door hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen now sits perched atop the cash cart, Saul's briefcase opened beside him (he has removed half of Lyman's "emeralds"). He hears the muffled Danny's slaps and he knows: it's time for his leap. It's the same distance as the leap he made in the practice session, but this time he's only got one good hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Livingston watch nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fin says he shorts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen prepares for his leap, then springs... ... across the room, to the ledge he must grab... ... and he grabs it, but with only one hand he's slipping right away, and in a second he'll hit the sensored floor... ... but, in a flash, he spins and splits his legs, propping himself up between two walls, inches above the floor. An acrobatic wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Livingston exhale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wishing he had bet) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE VAULT
dialogues.text: Danny, oblivious to this close call, slaps the door again. A moment passes, then: Yen responds with a slap, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Basher enters, Livingston and Frank watch on a monitor Linus punching in the combination he stole from Benedict as Danny unravels a thin electrical wire connected to a detonator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still the five pins and the floor sensor. Not much we can do about that from this side of the door. But from this side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He punches up the image of Yen in the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a little bit of Semtex should do the trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01                                1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen sets the last of Lyman's emeralds against the vault door like a plastic explosive... which, of course, it is. He affixes a detonator receiver (the size of a golf ball pencil) to it, then slaps the door twice: all set.

dialogues.speaker: A224 OUTSIDE VAULT
dialogues.text: Danny responds with two slaps of his own. He steps back, detonator in hand, its wires attached to the vault door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counting down from twenty -- (checking watch) -- now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen starts his retreat from the door, but gets yanked back. His hand's bandage is caught on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- seventeen, sixteen, fifteen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen tries to free himself, but he can't use his other hand lest he drop to the floor. He tries gnawing at his bandage, which brings his face within inches of a plastic explosive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- eleven, ten, nine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston et al. are alert to the danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mike) Linus, can you read me? Linus, do not blow the door, you're about to kill Yen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: G224 OUTSIDE VAULT
dialogues.text: Linus hears nothing through his earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- five, four, three --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen finally frees himself just as -- -- ZOOMING INTO a plastic explosive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses his detonator. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen, still on the door, remains frozen.       Trembling. A beat. Then, he starts to creep back, leaping onto a money shelf, then another, as far from the explosives as he can get.

dialogues.speaker: K224 OUTSIDE VAULT
dialogues.text: Danny presses it again.      Still nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus comes over to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You check the batteries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny blanches.    Linus shoots him a look. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston, Frank, and Basher watch the monitors in disbelief... Saul enters, alive and dressed as himself again.      His job is complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything going okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Danny checks his batteries (the types with built-in power meters: both at zero percent), Linus ransacks the Uzi-carrying Guards' gear for replacements. He finds AA's in their flashlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you lose focus for one second in this game --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and someone gets hurt, yeah yeah. I don't hear Yen complaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the batteries, inserts them in his detonator, then slaps the door twice more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen catches his breath on the far end of the room. He hears the slap, rolls his eyes, and ducks out of the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: B226 OUTSIDE VAULT
dialogues.text: Danny presses the detonator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "EMERALDS" EXPLODE.

dialogues.speaker: D226 OUTSIDE VAULT
dialogues.text: Several MUTED but powerful BLASTS. Linus inches forward, almost dreading this moment, pauses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01                               12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus pulls... and the door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Linus enter. Silence. The cash carts have crumpled, and the vault gratings, blackened, have held.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus goes to one of the racks and tentatively opens it... Yen pops up from within, his hair on end, looking like he just dropped out of a cyclone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his only English) Where the fuck you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston, Frank, Saul, and Basher watch as the first wave of bills gets tossed onto the vault floor. Smiles all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever been in love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers it for a moment) No, I guess not. Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty steps forward as people stream past him out of the fight arena. He dials his cell phone, listens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING WITH Benedict and Tess, pushing their way out through the crowd. A PHONE is RINGING nearby... again and again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna answer it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a cell phone. They keep moving, but the RING pursues them. Finally, Benedict stops, pulls Tess's purse from her shoulder and opens it: inside, he finds a CELL PHONE, RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See who's on the other end. She takes the phone, activates it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have a word with Mr. Benedict, please? Tess looks up, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for you. Benedict takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: ON RUSTY
dialogues.text: in the distance, at the arena's exit, unseen by Benedict or Tess, on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man who's robbing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict enters, and fear enters with him. And, of course, Tess. As the room buzzes with activity, he keeps the cell phone pressed to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on down there in the vault?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, sir.    All normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me. Fat points to the security-cam view of the vault corridor and vault -- Livingston's tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone, venomously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you're mistaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Basher and Saul watch over Livingston's shoulder as this phone conversation is broadcast over a small speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're watching your monitor? Okay, keep watching. Livingston punches in numbers...

dialogues.speaker: ON FAT'S MONITOR
dialogues.text: New images suddenly appear. Three masked men in the vault throw stacks of money onto the floor; the three Uzi Guards lie bound and unconscious in the corridor. The security center, understandably, erupts in activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00                              1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty strolls so casually there's no reason anyone passing would suspect he was doing more than ordering a pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this town, your luck can change just that quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (close to apoplectic, takes a breath and cups the phone, then barks at Walsh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out how much money we have down there. Tess, amid all this chaos, is still curious: how did that cell phone get into her handbag? And suddenly it hits her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye. Danny starts for her cheek, stops to see if it's alright with her -- she, sad-eyed, does not recoil -- and then gently kisses it... ... as he slips the cell phone into her handbag, unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. You've proved your point. You've broken into my vault. Congratulations: you're a dead man. Tess leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask: how do you expect to leave here, hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BENEDICT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe I'll simply allow you to parade bags full of my money out my casino doors? A distance beyond Rusty, Tess exits the cages. She stops, puzzling over what to do, happens to spot him. RUSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   You're gonna carry it out for us. BENEDICT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has to laugh) And why would I do that? RUSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a closer look at your monitor... OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00                              1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict does. As the three masked men stuff money into large canvas bags and mark the bags with X's, another portion of cash remains untouched, booby-trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As your manager's probably reporting to you by now, you have a little over a hundred sixty million in your vault tonight. And, as if Rusty was in the room watching, Walsh approaches with the night's cash count: $163,156,759.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may notice: we're only packing up about half that. The other half we're leaving in your vault, booby-trapped, as a hostage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let our eighty million go, and you get to keep your eighty. That's the deal. You try and stop us, we'll blow both cash loads.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He spins and -- gasp -- comes face-to-face with Tess. She stares at him directly: she knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding her glance) Mr. Benedict: you can lose eighty million dollars secretly tonight or you can lose a hundred sixty million dollars publicly. It's your decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cups the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict cups his phone, too, and vents his rage. He knows what he should do -- let the money go -- and he knows what he wants to do -- stop these sonsabitches.   H makes his choice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Walsh) Make the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh grabs a phone, punches numbers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 911.    Emergency response...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston listens in on the call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, this is Mr. Walsh at the Bellagio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have an incident here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncupping his phone) Okay.   You have a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess and Rusty hold a stare as Rusty holds the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Danny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine. He wants you to go upstairs, and watch TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, Tess. I promise. (back on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Here's what you do. Five minutes from now, the men in the vault are going to deposit six bags in the vault elevator. Tess isn't sure what to do. As Rusty continues on the phone, she backs off, debating: can she blow the whistle on her ex?

dialogues.speaker: SIX CANVAS BAGS
dialogues.text: each sealed tight, each marked with an X, loaded onto the vault elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they meet anyone, we'll blow the money in the bags and the money in the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small cadre of guards await the arrival of the vault elevator. Its doors open to reveal the six large canvas bags, each sealed tight, marked with an X.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute after that, the elevator will rise to your cages. Six of your guards will pick up the bags and carry them out into the casino. Six guards do precisely that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING WITH Rusty PAST slot machines...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they take more than twenty seconds to reach the casino floor or if there's any indication a switch has been made, we'll blow the money in the vault and the money in the bags. A SLOT MACHINE RINGS behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and Benedict hears it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Walsh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the casino right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I'm in the casino. In fact, I'm staying in your hotel. And I have two words for you: mini-bar. (back to business)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now as soon as your guards hit the casino floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six guards appear from the cage door, carrying six canvas bags marked with X's; Bellagio security escorts them from the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a white unmarked van is going to pull up in your valet station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white VAN (now clean of the "Nevada Telecom" sign) IDLES before the Bellagio, its windows tinted, the driver's identity inscrutable. It is swarmed by security, but they maintain a wide perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your guards will load the bags into the van's rear. If anyone so much as approaches the driver's door, we blow everything.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The guards carry out the money and load it into the van's rear. There, they find a video camera mounted within the back seat of the van monitoring them. Still they cannot catch a glimpse of the driver. They close the van doors.

dialogues.speaker: BELLAGIO
dialogues.text: The white van departs the valet station in front, clandestinely shadowed by five sedans. Meanwhile, behind the casino, a SWAT van arrives and unloads its squad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, when I get word that the van hasn't been followed, that the money is secure, my men will exit the building, and once their safety is confirmed, you'll get your vault back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh mouths to Benedict: "SWAT team is here."   Benedict nods and throws him a thumbs-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I have complied with your every request, would you agree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Now I have one of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at last, his venom released) Run and hide. If you get picked up next week buying a $100,000 sports car in Newport Beach, I'll be supremely disappointed. Because I want my people to find you. And rest assured: when they do, they won't hand you over to the police. (beat) Run and hide. That's all I ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And during the above rant by Benedict, we view... OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: MIRADOR SUITE
dialogues.text: now empty, Livingston's monitors still displaying the masked men in the vault.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE VAN
dialogues.text: navigating the streets of Las Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: FIVE SEDANS
dialogues.text: tailing the van, security goons piled into each, and maybe we NOTICE (or maybe not) the Rolls-Royce tailing them.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: pacing in Benedict's suite, biting her nails, debating whether to blow the whistle on Danny. ON TV: a newscast of the contentious aftermath of the prize fight.

dialogues.speaker: A254 UZI GUARDS,
dialogues.text: bound and unarmed, unconscious to the activity within the vault.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY'S CELL PHONE
dialogues.text: opened and unmanned.

dialogues.speaker: A255 BENEDICT
dialogues.text: listens -- the line has gone dead.   He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys say the van is headed toward McCarren Airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get everyone in position. I want my vault back before that van hits the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONGER MONTAGE now, CUTTING BETWEEN:

dialogues.speaker: SWAT TEAM
dialogues.text: (six in all) hustling through the cage corridors, armed to the teeth, with body armor and helmets and vision guards: they're as faceless as storm troopers. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00                              1

dialogues.speaker: WHITE VAN CONVOY
dialogues.text: as it approaches McCarren Airport.

dialogues.speaker: MONITORS OF THE VAULT
dialogues.text: The three masked men pace beside the booby-trapped money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on second inspection) Where's Zerga? (off Walsh's sheepish look) Mr. Zerga? With the briefcase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's -- he died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict shoots him a slow, sideways glance.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT TEAM
dialogues.text: rappelling down the elevator shaft -- its ultraviolet sensors turned off by Walsh -- then moving into position...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio, on monitor) Night goggles on. Prepare to cut power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat mans the power switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready when you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict scours the monitors: The masked men continue to pace on one screen. The SWAT team prepares to invade on another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Cut it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat flips the power switch. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston's monitors all go black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitors here go black as well.   Benedict listens closely to the SWAT frequency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Leader's voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First wave, in! Second wave, now! (there is RUNNING, PANTING, then Linus's voice, distant and panicked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, someone's here! (Leader's voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him down! Now! A brief SPURT of GUNFIRE, then... BARRROOOOOOM! Dead silence in the Eye in the Sky. Slim stares deep into a monitor's dark pitch. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Leader's voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights! We need power now! Fat flips the power back on, and on the monitors... ... visions of destruction down below... smoke fills the vault as two SWAT members push through it... other SWAT members help evacuate the unconscious guards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the situation down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They blew it. They blew the... Oh, Jesus... If there was anyone in there, they're not in one piece anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Walsh, soberly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them to take the van. I'm going down there. (as an afterthought, to Slim)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out how they fiddled with our cameras. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00                              1 262   EXT. McCARREN AIRPORT - NIGHT As the white van arrives at a charter airline's entrance, the five sedans converge upon it, TIRES SCREECHING, Goons emerging, weapons drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the van, now!   Now! No response within the van. The Head Goon signals and the others SHOOT the van's tires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim investigates the Eye in the Sky's wiring.    Reachin deep into a mesh, he finds a foreign object: Livingston's "spider."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vault elevator doors open and Terry Benedict makes his way into his smoke-filled vault corridor. He passes the Uzi Guards, awake now and stumbling to the elevator with SWAT members' assistance, then arrives before his decimated vault: Anything within -- people, money, Lyman Zerga's emeralds -- could only have been destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: OVER SWAT LEADER'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: as he approaches Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Benedict...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We couldn't find any survivors. Or, I'm afraid, any of your money. I'm sorry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't want to hear anymore; the SWAT team failed him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your men out now. HOLD ON Benedict, seething, as the SWAT Leader steps away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, guys, grab your gear and clear out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie he has with him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh: How are we with the van? 265   EXT. McCARREN AIRPORT - NIGHT The stalemate with the van continues.    Still no movemen from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the van now! Hands up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EMPLOYEE from the charter airline sticks his head out of his office door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) Hey, what's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-a-dozen firearms turn and point in his direction. The Employee disappears back inside his office. The Head Goon cautiously approaches the van, reaches for the driver's door, and yanks it open... Inside: There is no driver. Just a video camera mounted at eye-level. The Head Goon cranes back his head, befuddled, when he notices for the first time (and maybe we do, too) an enormous antenna sprouting from the van's rear bumper. The van suddenly lurches.

dialogues.speaker: SHORT DISTANCE AWAY
dialogues.text: complete with a tiny video monitor (displaying the van driver's POV) and a steering mechanism -- it's a near- replica of the one Virgil Malloy used in the monster truck drag race against his brother. And Virgil's using it now, too, as he sits next to Reuben Tishkoff in one of Reuben's Rolls and watches the Goons scramble back from the flat-tired van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough monkey business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgil brings the van to a stop, then readies a distinctive red button on his remote.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH VAN
dialogues.text: As the Head Goon reaches for the rear door, his hand inches away when... ... BARROOOOM!    The door EXPLODES open! Knocked on his ass, the Head Goon watches as the canvas "X" bags within burn to cinders. He does, however, happen to notice one burning shred of paper dislodged from a bag: It's a promotional flier for a call girl service. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00                             13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict steps over the scattered remains of his vault. He picks up a fragment of a cash cart, burnt to a crisp, then lets it drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Benedict...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly, this is bad news)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they blew up the bags, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dropping his walkie- talkie to his side)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Walsh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say it doesn't look like there was any money in the bags, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say the bags were filled with fliers. For hookers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean there was no money in the bags?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they said, sir. I don't understand it: we both saw them putting money inside those bags.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Benedict stops cold. He stares up at a wall where an engraved sign reading "Bellagio" has been smoke-stained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh, cue up the tape of the robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh stands before several monitors as Slim cues up the "masked men robbing the vault" image of a few minutes ago beside the present image of Benedict staring at the vault wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it say 'Bellagio' on the south wall of the vault?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the masked-men image it does not, in fact, say "Bellagio" there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on walkie-talkie) No, sir. It doesn't. I -- I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had that installed on Tuesday. The image we saw of the men robbing us was a tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone built a double of my vault, then made a tape of them robbing it. When we saw them putting money in those bags, that wasn't actually happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh's jaw drops as he watches the tape again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict is absolutely fucking furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... what happened to all the money?

dialogues.speaker: SWAT DUFFEL BAG
dialogues.text: carried through the Bellagio casino, held by the SWAT Leader leading his men out (now eight in all), and at last we PULL UP to see his face for the first time... It's Rusty, in full regalia, leading Livingston, Turk, Saul, Frank, Basher, Yen and Linus out of the casino, each dressed as a SWAT member, each carrying a duffel bag with nearly $20 million dollars inside. As we PASS each man, under the HUM OF the CASINO, we see:

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: takes the call from Walsh in the Mirador suite as Basher, Saul, and Frank dress behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9-1-1.   Emergency response.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: dressed as a SWAT member, hustles down a cage corridor.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: has trouble rappelling with the rest.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: takes position next to Rusty at the elevator shaft's bottom. They're on-camera, but just a few feet away and (off-camera) Danny sits smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hiding his voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare to cut power!

dialogues.speaker: YEN
dialogues.text: lights a short fuse leading into the vault... OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 4/16/01                              14

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: feigns hysteria...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, someone's here!

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: FIRES a SPURT of BLANKS. BARRROOOOM! No one is hurt. Nor is the money, stacked neatly in a corridor, ready to be packed into the phony SWAT team bags, body armor, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT team exits and boards the second vehicle Turk and Virgil have been working on all this time, the one in the warehouse with an air freshener hanging from its rearview mirror: it's a replica of a SWAT van. Turk takes the wheel as the others jump in the back. Rusty flips open another cell phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Las Vegas P.D. This is Officer Brooks, New Jersey Probation Division. I have a violator in your jurisdiction... (cupping phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit it. Turk hits the gas and the VEHICLE PEELS away, carrying it cadre of new multi-millionaires far away from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict squats down to inspect a burnt scrap of paper on the vault floor. It's a flier for a strip joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (and it finally occurs to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ocean...

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Heated, he approaches the interrogation room, where his Plainclothes Goons keep watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 4/16/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Ocean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still inside, sir. With Bruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Benedict straightens his cuffs, cools himself, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open that door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruiser throws a mean left hook across Danny's face as the door swings open and Benedict steps in. Bruiser sees him and steps away, toweling off his bloodied knuckles. Benedict studies Danny: the man is a bloody mess, head rolling, eyes puffed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Goons step in, slap Danny alert.       At last, Danny recognizes Benedict in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little punchy) Heya, Benedict... How's the other fight going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict keeps his cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have a hand in this? (beat) Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I have a hand in what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict scrutinizes Danny: Is he bluffing?       He look Bruiser, then Danny again, and decides: no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Goons scoop him up and drag him out, Danny catches Bruiser's eye for just a moment. And barely winks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS.      Tess plucks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (if you must know, it's Livingston's) Turn to Channel 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK.   Tess does so. On her TV: A security-angle of the cage hallway.   The Goons appear, escorting bloodied Danny out. As Tess gasps, we go live to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Benedict follows the Goons and Danny out, brooding: what's his next step? Walsh approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get robbed or something, Benedict? Geez, that's a shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict looks up, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Goons stop, spin Danny around to face Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where.   Is.   My. Money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hold each other's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say if I told you you could get your money back... (beat) ... if you gave up Tess? (beat) What would you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would say yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's crestfallen. OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01                                1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's very interesting... (beat) ... but I didn't have anything to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins.   Benedict sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his Goons) Escort Mr. Ocean to the exit. And contact the police. I would imagine Mr. Ocean is in violation of his parole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Goons haul Danny out. Tess has left, heartbeats ago: the room's door is just closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should have held him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Follow him. Everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict exits. Takes in his casino. It's been a bad night: he's down a hundred fifty million. He starts for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he arrives, the elevator doors open and Tess steps out. She breezes right past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess... (as she doesn't stop) Tess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You of all people should know, Terry: in your hotel, there's always someone watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She keeps going. Benedict, now down a hundred fifty million and one woman, boards the elevator. Its doors close on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT van rounds a corner and ducks inside the warehouse. Three-and-a-half seconds pass. And the eight SWAT members reappear, now all in suits, perfectly pressed, and with grins on their faces and change in their pockets, they begin their victory stroll, single-file and sloppy... right down the...

dialogues.speaker: STRIP
dialogues.text: Turk, Livingston, Frank, Basher, Yen, Saul, Linus and Rusty march down the strip single-file, and when they come to an intersection... ... Virgil and Reuben, also in suits, fall into stride for a victory lap in front of the Bellagio fountains. Then, one-by-one, the group splinters off, strolling into different hotels or grabbing cabs, until there are only two left: Rusty and Linus. They take each other in, shake hands, and part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess exits, searching for Danny.   She rounds the buildin to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a LVPD squad car has just arrived to take goon-held Danny away. She runs toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do. As Danny is handcuffed and prepared for loading in the back, he and Tess hold each other's glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01                        145A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny... (beat) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew what I was doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 10/24/00

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A cop lowers Danny's head as he directs him into his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will you be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrug) Three to six months, I should think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad car door closes him in and Tess stands vigil as it pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS STREET
dialogues.text: Rusty watches Danny being driven back to prison, too.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: The great metal gate opens once more, revealing Danny Ocean in its frame again, ready for release. He looks forward -- no one's there to greet him, and the view of New Jersey looks no brighter than it did before. He takes his first step into free America... ... to discover Rusty leaning against the prison wall. Beyond him sits his second-hand Mercedes from L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirteen million and you drive that piece of shit cross country to pick me up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello to you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shakes hands.    Rusty looks Danny over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair's grayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your eyes got closer together. (beat) How's life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life... is a roomful of pillows. (beat) C'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING WITH Danny and Rusty toward the Mercedes, together again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want to go first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty had anticipated this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped and picked up your personal effects, put them in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny gets to the passenger door and looks in to see Tess sitting in the back. She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling back, then) I'm not sure these belong to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Rusty get in.      Danny kisses Tess.   Rusty S the CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to find Rusty a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a women's prison just down the road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCEAN'S 11 - Rev. 1/8/01                               14

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He drives off. In the back, Danny takes Tess's hand in his. Notices a silver wedding band on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you sold this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they drive away... ... another car STARTS its ENGINE begins to follow.   At the wheel: Benedict's goons.
